description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Improved session reliability in local flows, including OpenCode migration recovery and soul starter observability.
- Refined action button styling and compact controls across settings and sidebars for clearer UX.
Fixes & polish
- Kept soul internals agent-facing and improved steering visibility.
- Retuned compact button behavior for better theme consistency.
- Updated i18n copy and added release verification screenshots/docs for the new flows.
Packaging / ops
- Bumped OpenWork packages to 0.11.101 and refreshed lockfiles.
- Updated AUR packaging metadata for the current release.
